title: Issue with re-training

labels.name: howtousedlc
labels.description: issue regarding the use of DeepLabCut

body:
Hi, First of all, thank you so much for the wonderful program, I am working on multi-mouse behavior tracking during their social interactions. I have a trouble when I try to expend training set, could help me to understand the error? OS: Windows 10 with an Anaconda Env DeepLabCut Version: maDLC-GPU 2.2b8 **Describe the problem** I got an error message when I tried to train network with expended training set. After the initial training, I refined the tracklets using refine tracklet GUI, and merge refine data. After done this, I also refined label using refine label GUI, merge the dataset afterwards, which successfully created a new 'iteration-1' folder in trainingset folder. I created training set using Create training set, (I set the "specify the training dataset index" as 1), which works well. After creating the new training set, I tried to train network, and when I set "specify the training dataset index" as 1, DLC gives me an error IndexError: list index out of range Which part I was missing here? Could you help me to understand the error? Many thanks!
Code output

(DLC-GPu) C:\Users\sahay>python -m deeplabcut Starting GUI... note to user: currently only ResNet50-v1 is available for maDLC note to user: currently model comparison is not available in maDLC D:\DLC\invivoMashBax_social-ac-2021-03-12\training-datasets\iteration-1\UnaugmentedDataSet_invivoMashBax_socialMar12 already exists! Utilizing the following graph: [[1, 3], [5, 6], [0, 2], [1, 6], [2, 5], [0, 3], [1, 2], [1, 5], [3, 6], [0, 4], [2, 6], [4, 5], [1, 4], [2, 3], [3, 5], [0, 1], [4, 6], [3, 4], [2, 4]] Creating training data for 1 0.95 This can take some time... 100%|██████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████| 3450/3450 [01:07<00:00, 50.83it/s] D:\DLC\invivoMashBax_social-ac-2021-03-12\dlc-models\iteration-1\invivoMashBax_socialMar12-trainset95shuffle1 already exists! D:\DLC\invivoMashBax_social-ac-2021-03-12\dlc-models\iteration-1\invivoMashBax_socialMar12-trainset95shuffle1\train already exists! D:\DLC\invivoMashBax_social-ac-2021-03-12\dlc-models\iteration-1\invivoMashBax_socialMar12-trainset95shuffle1\test already exists! The training dataset is successfully created. Use the function 'train_network' to start training. Happy training! Traceback (most recent call last): File "C:\Users\sahay\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPu\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\gui\train_network.py", line 329, in train_network maxiters=maxiters, File "C:\Users\sahay\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPu\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\pose_estimation_tensorflow\training.py", line 140, in train_network cfg["TrainingFraction"][trainingsetindex], shuffle, cfg, modelprefix=modelprefix File "C:\Users\sahay\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPu\lib\site-packages\ruamel\yaml\compat.py", line 273, in __getitem__ return self.__getsingleitem__(index) File "C:\Users\sahay\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPu\lib\site-packages\ruamel\yaml\comments.py", line 388, in __getsingleitem__ return list.__getitem__(self, idx) IndexError: list index out of range

**How to Reproduce the problem** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Go to 'train network' 2. Click on 'specify training set index -> 1' list index out of range ![error for retraining](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/75436015/112492802-f5c60a80-8d57-11eb-9164-eae2870f4e00.PNG) ![Capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/75436015/112492938-168e6000-8d58-11eb-807b-22106f1e7f7a.PNG)
